html:
Visit DC Parks? There's an App for That!

Download the free DC Area National Parks App in the Apple and Google Play stores to find, explore and learn about parks in our area.

Dumbarton House Hosts Flower Power With Sidra Forman

Join Dumbarton House staff and DC-based floral artist Sidra Forman for an hour-long virtual program on flowers September 30, 2020 from 6:30 to 7:30 pm.

Five Things I Can't Live Without

Not counting family, friends and pets. Or masks.

Sculpture Garden at Kreeger Museum Reopens

The Kreeger Museum’s Sculpture Garden has reopened with limited capacity and hours.

House of Sweden Reopens Labor Day Weekend

House of Sweden reopens to the general public Labor Day weekend.

Bon-Chi: The Art of Edible Bonsai

Did you know that bonsai chilis are perennial trees and with the right care you can transform them into magnificent plants that grow all year long!

Film Noir Style: The Killer 1940s Sept. 29

Join historian and author of Film Noir Style: The Killer 1940s Kimberly Truhler for a dive into the dark side of forties style and a celebration of the film noir genre's most influential films and stars. September 29, 2020 from 7:00-8:00 pm.

Halcyon Wins Grant for Entrepreneurs

The D.C. nonprofit, Halcyon, which runs an incubator and programs for social entrepreneurs, is putting plans in motion to build its own investor group focused on social impact investments after winning grant money from the U.S.

Reckoning the Legacy of Race and Racism in Georgetown Sept. 1

Join a panel of thought leaders, academics, and descendants, for a conversation about race and racism in Georgetown on September 1 at 6:30 pm-8:00 pm. This event is virtual.

Blood and Strikes: American Labor in the 20th Century

Learn about the bloody and controversial struggle for worker's rights in 20th century America.

Fairmont Open for Dining

The Fairmont’s Lobby Bar, Loggia and courtyard reopened Tuesday, August 25th.

Vote Safe DC

In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, the DC Board of Elections (BOE or the Board) has developed the Vote Safe DC campaign.

Dolley Days at Dumbarton Aug. 22 & 23

Celebrate the anniversary of Dolley Madison’s flight from the White House to Dumbarton House in 1814 on August 22nd from 10:00 am till 3:00 pm.

Biden-Harris A Historic Winning Ticket

Senator Kamala Harris (D-CA) has always been my first choice for vice president. While it was clear Vice President Biden had many good choices from which to choose, the one who stood out from the crowd was Harris.

Amazon Go Grocery Coming to DC

Amazon is planning to open cashier-less “Go” grocery stores in Washington D.C.

DIGEST DESIGN X: How Disease Dictates Design

Family Game Night From the Comfort of Your Safe-House

Does your family have what it takes to be spies? Now’s your chance to find out.

DC Summer Restaurant Week Aug. 17-30

DC's Summer Restaurant Week is back this month, running for two weeks instead of one.

Celebrate Bella Abzug’s Centennial with a Statue

July 24, 2020 Bella S. Abzug (D-NY) would have turned 100. Her impact on the nation through her activism, brilliance and tenacity will long be remembered. Her short six years in Congress left an outsized impression on the nation.

Dumbarton House Celebrates Women's Suffrage Aug.18

Join Dumbarton House to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the ratification of the 19th amendment on August 18, 2020 from 7:00 to 7:00 pm.

Olivia de Havilland

Victura Park is a family-friendly outdoor pop-up & wine garden located in the River Pavilion at The REACH.

National Zoo reopens Friday, July 24, 2020.

Several changes at the Zoo have been made due to COVID-19.

Hollywood & Spy: Virtual Happy Hour July 23

Join Spy Museum’s virtual Happy Hour with hosts: Amanda Ohlke, Shana Oltmans, and Hannah Saloio for a whirlwind visit to the corner of Hollywood and Spy on July 23, 2020 from 5:30 to 6:30 pm.

Tudor Place Reopens Aug. 6

Tudor Place garden and grounds reopen August 6, 2020 to the public. Members can reserve tickets now for July 30 through August 2.

West Wing Reopens July 20

The West Building ground floor of the National Gallery of Art will reopen on July 20th, 2020.

Free, timed passes will be required for entry.

Get Your 'I Do' Passport at Ritz-Carlton Georgetown Aug.8

You’re invited on Saturday, August 8, 2020 from 10:00 am until 4:00 pm for an interactive wedding vendor hall and a panel with DMV industry experts at the Ritz-Carlton Georgetown, 3100 South Street NW.

Shakespeare Theatre to Rebroadcast 'Mock Trial'

If you didn’t get the chance to watch the Shakespeare Theatre’s Mock Trail you have two more chances to do so. If you bought a ticket the first time and missed it on June 22nd, this is your chance to see it or you can register for the first time.

A Message to the Community from the Georgetown Community Partnership

Georgetown University has released its plan for the Fall, 2020 semester.

Georgetown's Got Streatery

The Georgetown BID and DDOT are working together to widen Wisconsin Avenue and M Street sidewalks to allow for more outside dining space.

Meet new friends at The Phillips Collection on July 9, 2020 from 5:30 to 6:30 pm.

Explore Italy's Castello della Manta July 9

Escape to the beauty of Italy - no passport required.

Muriel Bowser Shines As Mayor

It is often said a crisis can bring out the best or the worst in people. We are confronting two crises at the same time in the United States; the coronavirus pandemic and the murder of George Floyd and the ensuing Black Lives Matter protests.
